str2: Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To persist, persevere in, continue steadfast in; I wait upon.
From philos and hippos; fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ek and histemi; to put out of wits, i.e. Astound, or become astounded, insane.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of semaino; an indication, especially ceremonially or supernaturally.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
